item.title: Forget retirement: Martha Stewart wants to be a ‘super ager’—she wakes up at 4 a.m., packs in brain games and pilates, before staff arrive at 7 a.m
item.description: Martha Stewart doesn’t allow herself to sleep in—and the first self-made female billionaire in America expects her staff to bring their a-game by 7 a....

item.title: Red Lobster’s 36-year-old CEO got the company out of bankruptcy. Now he’s plotting the ‘greatest comeback in the history of the restaurant industry’
item.description: “Of course it’s risky,” Damola Adamolekun told Fortune’s Ruth Umoh. “I took over a company that’s bankrupt and had a lot of problems.”

item.title: Climate-conscious Vermont ski resort hires goats to mow its lawn: ‘They’re great employees. They take a lot of lunch breaks, but that’s kind of the idea’
item.description: Herd owner Adam Ricci says he hopes to scale it and build a model to the point where it can be used at other ski resorts.

item.title: Hollywood erupts as talent agents circle ‘AI actor’ Tilly Norwood: ‘Not surprised the first major AI actor is a young woman they can fully control’
item.description: The entertainment industry recently grappled with AI during the four-month SAG-AFTRA strike work stoppage in 2023.

item.title: Ron DeSantis just took over $66 million worth of prime Miami real estate and gifted it to Trump for a presidential library
item.description: It's the latest demonstration by top Florida Republicans of their loyalty to Trump.
